medical_history.chief_complaint: Progressively declining vision associated with limb malformations and dermatologic anomalies.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented with progressively declining vision, severe photophobia, and was diagnosed with bilateral horizontal and conjugate nystagmus. The limb malformations and dermatologic anomalies were noted from birth, with surgical intervention for right-hand syndactyly taking place at age 4.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Tetramelic SHFM surgically addressed at age 4. Normal psychomotor development.
medical_history.family_history: A 13-year-old sister with progressively declining vision and congenital cone dystrophy, and a deceased brother at 2 months old from congenital heart malformation.
